clustering_scheme.rationale: Both theories emphasize knowledge and participation as engines of progression from newcomers to core, so the model is organized into four tightly-coupled modules: contributor pipeline (stocks and transitions), knowledge management (tacit/explicit stocks and SECI flows), mentoring/participation (social learning capacity and LPP), and recruitment/onboarding (boundary inflows and early attrition). This layout keeps each sub-process compact and connects them with a few well-defined interfaces.

clusters.name: Contributor Pipeline
clusters.theme: Progression from newcomers to experienced to core and associated pipeline flows.

clusters.name: Knowledge Management (SECI)
clusters.theme: Accumulation and erosion of explicit and tacit knowledge and their effects on learning.

clusters.name: Mentoring & Participation (CoP)
clusters.theme: Community mentoring capacity, legitimate peripheral participation, and social learning intensity.

clusters.name: Recruitment & Onboarding
clusters.theme: Boundary management: inflow of newcomers and early-stage attrition shaped by LPP quality.

layout_hints: Place Contributor Pipeline centrally; it has the most inter-cluster connections.
Position Knowledge Management on the left and Mentoring & Participation on the right to shorten knowledge–learning and mentoring–progression links.
Place Recruitment & Onboarding above the Contributor Pipeline near New Contributors to minimize crossing lines for onboarding and attrition flows.
Route SECI-related links along the top edge between Knowledge and Pipeline; route LPP/mentoring links along the right edge to reduce crossings.

theories.name: Communities of Practice (Wenger)
theories.rationale: Wenger’s CoP highlights learning through participation and movement from periphery to core via legitimate peripheral participation (LPP). The current model includes mentoring and promotion but lacks explicit representation of LPP quality, mentoring capacity, and the boundary inflow/early attrition dynamics that determine whether newcomers move inward. These additions make participation quality and capacity explicit drivers of skill-up, onboarding, and retention.

variables.name: Prospective Contributors
variables.description: Pool of potential newcomers exposed to the project who have not yet contributed.

variables.name: Newcomer Onboarding Rate
variables.description: Rate at which Prospective Contributors become New Contributors.

variables.name: New Contributor Attrition
variables.description: Rate at which New Contributors exit before becoming experienced.

variables.name: Community Mentoring Capacity
variables.description: Effective mentor-hours available; function of Core Developer and Experienced Contributors and their mentoring allocation.

variables.name: Legitimate Peripheral Participation Quality
variables.description: Quality of newcomer participation experience; reflects access to mentors and meaningful tasks.

variables.name: Developer's Turnover
variables.rationale: Make the outflow specific to the Core Developer stock for clarity.

variables.name: colored stock
variables.rationale: Name is vague and violates naming guidelines; replaced by 'Prospective Contributors' which is specific to onboarding.

theories.name: Nonaka's SECI Model
theories.rationale: SECI requires explicit representation of tacit and explicit knowledge stocks and the socialization, externalization, combination, and internalization processes. The current model proxies transfer but lacks knowledge accumulation/decay and knowledge loss from turnover. Adding knowledge stocks and SECI-aligned flows grounds learning rates and reduces over-reliance on implicit assumptions.

variables.name: Project Explicit Knowledge
variables.description: Codified project knowledge (docs, guides) that persists over time.

variables.name: Externalization Rate
variables.description: Creation of explicit knowledge from experience; documentation and guide writing.

variables.name: Explicit Knowledge Decay Rate
variables.description: Obsolescence and staleness of documentation leading to effective loss.

variables.name: Tacit Knowledge Accumulation Rate
variables.description: Growth of tacit know-how via socialization and internalization.

variables.name: Tacit Knowledge Loss Rate
variables.description: Loss of tacit know-how due to departures and forgetting.

variables.name: Experienced Contributor Attrition
variables.description: Outflow of Experienced Contributors who leave the project.
